intro: Chondrilla laticoronata, commonly known as the broad-crown chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with silver-gray foliage adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Chondrilla laticoronata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability.
